SENT.plain: A 40-year-old woman presented with fever, dysarthria, and left hemiparesis
Diagnostic imaging detected an infarction in the right cerebrum; lupus anticoagulant was positive
A T4N3M0 adenocarcinoma coexisted in the left lung, which was irradiated once
Two days later, the superior mesenteric artery was occluded
The bowel was widely resected but she died of hepatic infarction
The lung cancer may have triggered catastrophic antiphospholipid syndrome
